Salt_Lake_City.Congregation Sharey Tzedek Synagogue:
Congregation Sharey Tzedek Synagogue (שערי צדק) is a historic Jewish synagogue at 833 South 200 East in Salt Lake City, Utah, United States.


== History ==
A group of mostly of Yiddish-speaking immigrants from Russia and elsewhere in Eastern Europe split off from Congregation Montefiore in 1916 to form Congregation Sharey Tzedek, Utah's third Jewish congregation. The group raised $33,200 to buy the land and build a synagogue.
